Definition 3.2.1. A function is continuous at a point Unknown identifier `c`sorry sorry : Propc Unknown identifier `S`S if for every Unknown identifier ``sorry > 0 : Prop > 0 there exists Unknown identifier ``sorry > 0 : Prop > 0 such that whenever Unknown identifier `x`sorry sorry : Propx Unknown identifier `S`S satisfies |sorry - sorry| < sorry : Prop|Unknown identifier `x`x - Unknown identifier `c`c| < Unknown identifier ``, then |sorry - sorry| < sorry : Prop|Unknown identifier `f`f x - Unknown identifier `f`f c| < Unknown identifier ``. A function is continuous on Unknown identifier `S`S if it is continuous at every point of Unknown identifier `S`S.

def continuousAtInSet (S : Set ) (f : S ) (c : S) : Prop := > 0, > 0, x : S, |(x : ) - (c : )| < |f x - f c| <

A function is continuous on Unknown identifier `S`S when it is continuous at every point of Unknown identifier `S`S.

def continuousOnSet (S : Set ) (f : S ) : Prop := c : S, continuousAtInSet S f c

The epsilon-delta continuity at a point agrees with mathlib's notion of continuity for subtype domains.

theorem continuousAtInSet_iff (S : Set ) (f : S ) (c : S) : continuousAtInSet S f c ContinuousAt f c := by constructor intro h refine (continuousAt_iff).2 ?_ intro h obtain , h, hprop := h h refine , h, ?_ intro x hx have hx' : |(x : ) - (c : )| < := by simpa [Real.dist_eq] using hx have hfx : |f x - f c| < := hprop x hx' simpa [Real.dist_eq] using hfx intro h have h' := (continuousAt_iff).1 h intro h obtain , h, hprop := h' h refine , h, ?_ intro x hx have hx' : dist x c < := by simpa [Real.dist_eq] using hx have hfx : dist (f x) (f c) < := hprop (x := x) hx' simpa [Real.dist_eq] using hfx

Continuity on a set agrees with mathlib's Continuous.{u, v} {X : Type u} {Y : Type v} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] (f : X Y) : PropContinuous for functions defined on a subtype of : Type.

theorem continuousOnSet_iff (S : Set ) (f : S ) : continuousOnSet S f Continuous f := by constructor intro h refine (continuous_iff_continuousAt).2 ?_ intro c exact (continuousAtInSet_iff S f c).1 (h c) intro h c have hc : ContinuousAt f c := (continuous_iff_continuousAt).1 h c exact (continuousAtInSet_iff S f c).2 hc

Proposition 3.2.5. If are continuous at Unknown identifier `c`sorry sorry : Propc Unknown identifier `S`S, then: (i) the sum is continuous at Unknown identifier `c`c; (ii) the difference is continuous at Unknown identifier `c`c; (iii) the product is continuous at Unknown identifier `c`c; (iv) if additionally Unknown identifier `g`sorry 0 : Propg x 0 for all Unknown identifier `x`sorry sorry : Propx Unknown identifier `S`S, the quotient is continuous at Unknown identifier `c`c.

lemma proposition_3_2_5 {S : Set } {f g : S } {c : S} (hf : ContinuousAt f c) (hg : ContinuousAt g c) (h0 : x : S, g x 0) : ContinuousAt (fun x : S => f x + g x) c ContinuousAt (fun x : S => f x - g x) c ContinuousAt (fun x : S => f x * g x) c ContinuousAt (fun x : S => f x / g x) c := by refine ?_, ?_, ?_, ?_ simpa using hf.add hg simpa [sub_eq_add_neg] using hf.add hg.neg simpa using hf.mul hg simpa using hf.div hg (h0 c)

Example 3.2.6. The sine and cosine functions on : Type are continuous. The book justifies this using trigonometric identities and the estimates |sorry| |sorry| : Prop|Unknown identifier `sin`sin x| |Unknown identifier `x`x|, failed to synthesize AddGroup Hint: Additional diagnostic information may be available using the `set_option diagnostics true` command.|sorry| 1 : Prop|Unknown identifier `cos`cos x| 1, and failed to synthesize AddGroup Hint: Additional diagnostic information may be available using the `set_option diagnostics true` command.|sorry| 1 : Prop|Unknown identifier `sin`sin x| 1.

lemma sin_is_continuous : Continuous fun x : => Real.sin x := by simpa using Real.continuous_sin
lemma cos_is_continuous : Continuous fun x : => Real.cos x := by simpa using Real.continuous_coslemma example_3_2_6 : Continuous (fun x : => Real.sin x) Continuous (fun x : => Real.cos x) := by exact sin_is_continuous, cos_is_continuous

Helper lemma for Proposition 3.2.7: composing Unknown identifier `hf`hf and Unknown identifier `hg`hg gives the desired continuity conclusion.

lemma comp_continuousAt_helper {A B : Set } {f : B } {g : A B} {c : A} (hf : ContinuousAt f (g c)) (hg : ContinuousAt g c) : ContinuousAt (fun x : A => f (g x)) c := by simpa [Function.comp] using hf.comp hg

Proposition 3.2.7. If is continuous at Unknown identifier `c`sorry sorry : Propc Unknown identifier `A`A and is continuous at Unknown identifier `g`g c, then the composition is continuous at Unknown identifier `c`c.

lemma composition_continuousAt {A B : Set } {f : B } {g : A B} {c : A} (hg : ContinuousAt g c) (hf : ContinuousAt f (g c)) : ContinuousAt (fun x : A => f (g x)) c := by simpa using comp_continuousAt_helper hf hg

Composing the reciprocal with the sine function yields a continuous function on .

Example 3.2.10. The function given by Unknown identifier `f`sorry = -1 : Propf x = -1 for Unknown identifier `x`sorry < 0 : Propx < 0 and Unknown identifier `f`sorry = 1 : Propf x = 1 for Unknown identifier `x`sorry 0 : Propx 0 has a jump discontinuity at 0 : 0.
